intro: Eugenioides tetrandrum, commonly known as the four-threaded eugenia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its small, oval leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. Eugenioides tetrandrum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and fragrant blooms.
